title: Jax Counter-Strike not dodging Garen Decisive Strike
body: I just played through a ranked game in which I was Jax vs Garen and thought that Counter-Strike would allow me to dodge the enemy Garens Decisive Strike. The first few times I tried to counter it, I ended up getting hit for the full damage and being silenced. At first I just thought maybe I had missed the activate on it. So I began trying to activate it earlier and earlier trying to get my timing down before realizing that it wasn't me, it was the ability. It wasn't just once, or one in five times, but every single time I used it the full effect of Decisive strike went through to the extent that I could not reactivate counter-strike to stun him because I was silenced. As far as what I have read people have confirmed that Jax should be able to dodge the strike, if I am wrong then this discussion can obviously be disregarded, but until I have somebody else I can fully test it with I don't know if this is an every game problem or if I just somehow went into the game with a one time glitch.

replies.body: Yeab, that's how it works. There are many auto-attack empowering spells that allows the attack to ignore dodge.
Wait, so it'll ignore dodge and not blind? When I play Garen vs Teemo I'll get the silence from my Q, but not the damage. That seems strange to me.
As far as I know, Dodge and Blinds function differently within the game engine.

> [{quoted}](name=Recnik,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=X1RE3E3A,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-03-10T00:50:41.176+0000)

> Teemo and Quinn's blind will only mitigate the basic attack damage, you'll still be hit by the ability.
> RIP Teemos everywhere.

Word which shouldn't be the case.

Logically, it makes zero sense.

A magically-imbued physical strike is still a physical strike.

If a unit avoids the strike because they blinded the target or legit dodges the strike so it misses, it should... y'know, legitimate miss.

I don't think the magic also applies a mystical heat-seeking, homing-property to the melee weapon.
The attack itself missed, the magic surrounding the weapon hits the enemy.

> [{quoted}](name=Aarekk,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=X1RE3E3A,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-03-10T04:21:16.111+0000)
>
> The attack itself missed, the magic surrounding the weapon hits the enemy.

Just as much of an issue. If the magic is imbuing the weapon & the weapon misses, the magic should also miss.
Imagine it being a near miss.  Not the opposite direction.  A really hot piece of metal near, but not touching, you will still radiate heat and could still burn you.

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Jax

Jax Counter-Strike only blocks auto attacks and mitigates area of effect spells. Garen's Decisive Strike is a spell, so it is supposed to be getting through. 

Cheers!
